intro: Homalium obovale, commonly known as the oval-leaf hollies, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. It produces non-toxic, fleshy berries that are typically orange to red in color. Homalium obovale is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
